solution_line_template: The Seattle Seahawks scored {field_goals_scored} field goals during the length of the game and each field goal is worth {points_per_field_goal} points, so {field_goals_scored} * {points_per_field_goal}=<<{field_goals_scored}*{points_per_field_goal}={points_from_field_goals}>>{points_from_field_goals} points were made by the Seattle Seahawks from field goals.

The Seattle Seahawks won so their total points would be {seahawks_total_score} with {points_from_field_goals} of those points accrued through the scoring of field goals, which makes {seahawks_total_score}-{points_from_field_goals}=<<{seahawks_total_score}-{points_from_field_goals}={points_from_touchdowns}>>{points_from_touchdowns} points left to be scored by touchdowns.

There are {points_from_touchdowns} points scored by touchdowns and each touchdown is worth {points_per_touchdown} points, so this means that {points_from_touchdowns}/{points_per_touchdown}=<<{points_from_touchdowns}/{points_per_touchdown}={number_of_touchdowns}>>{number_of_touchdowns} touchdowns were scored by the Seattle Seahawks throughout the game.
